{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3380681,"name":"Falon Clark","username":"Tatiman-Dev","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tatiman-dev/{size}/236095_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-06T15:39:53.849Z","cooked":"

Now that it’s the off-season i want to mess around more with advancing my teams capabilities. What do people do on the software side to make things like arm motion more stiff and crisp? Or is this entirely a mechanical problem when you have very wobbly motion

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-06T15:39:53.849Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":41,"reads":682,"readers_count":681,"score":386.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Falon Clark","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57393,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The Kotlin Guy"},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/1","custom_user_title":"The Kotlin Guy","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3380683,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-06T15:42:18.970Z","cooked":"
Tatiman-Dev:

Or is this entirely a mechanical problem when you have very wobbly motion

It is both. You need both a stiff mechanism and a stiff control loop for stiff motion.

Make sure you’re using a feedforward controller in addition to your feedback wherever possible, and make sure your position signal is clean and low-latency.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-06T15:42:18.970Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":681,"readers_count":680,"score":236.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/2","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3380691,"name":"Graeme McDaniel","username":"Graeme2451","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/graeme2451/{size}/226498_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-06T15:47:53.361Z","cooked":"

if u have the time take a look at 971 both in 2023 and 2018. They are known for their arms and being incredibly robust. 2451 ran an arm in 2023 and ours came down to mechanical stifness. One of the things that helped us incredibly was to use a cable pull over some other method of torque transfer.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-06T15:47:53.361Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":634,"readers_count":633,"score":201.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Graeme McDaniel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EHXUFjTa-A4","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55477,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"67 Mentor | 2451 Alum | FIM Game Announcer "},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/3","custom_user_title":"67 Mentor | 2451 Alum | FIM Game Announcer ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3380731,"name":"Carlos Salazar","username":"StarbuckBarista","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starbuckbarista/{size}/186251_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-06T16:31:15.760Z","cooked":"

Motion Profiling never hurts in making mechanism movements much smoother!

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-06T16:31:15.760Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":544,"readers_count":543,"score":138.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Carlos Salazar","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/advanced-controls/controllers/index.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Controllers — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":58}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57451,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming & Electrical Captain"},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/4","custom_user_title":"Programming & Electrical Captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3380801,"name":"Elijah Beard","username":"ebear11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-06T18:36:15.579Z","cooked":"

To add on to this, our team has had better luck when using an input shaft(TalonFX rotor in our case) as input for a control loop instead of output shaft (REV Through bore in our case). We synced them once and it is extremely smooth. Edit: Position control delegated to the motor controller just seems to work better in general as well.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-06T18:37:33.971Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":479,"readers_count":478,"score":100.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Elijah Beard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5402 Programming M̶e̶n̶t̶o̶r̶ Advisor"},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/5","custom_user_title":"5402 Programming M̶e̶n̶t̶o̶r̶ Advisor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3380825,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-06T19:03:55.715Z","cooked":"
ebear11:

To add on to this, our team has had better luck when using an input shaft(TalonFX rotor in our case) as input for a control loop instead of output shaft (REV Through bore in our case).

Collocated measurements are typically better, so I think this wasn’t the primary improvement you were seeing…

ebear11:

Edit: Position control delegated to the motor controller just seems to work better in general as well.

This, however, I definitely can believe - especially compared to decoding a REV thru-bore on the RIO.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-06T19:03:55.715Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":447,"readers_count":446,"score":104.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/6","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3381219,"name":"Elijah Beard","username":"ebear11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-07T11:54:10.464Z","cooked":"
Oblarg:

Collocated measurements are typically better, so I think this wasn’t the primary improvement you were seeing…

Well I guess it depends on how the robot is built. Our chain was always loose so the output had a lot of play compared to the input shaft. I think the motor controller delegation did help the most though with general smoothness.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-07T11:54:10.464Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":313,"readers_count":312,"score":77.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Elijah Beard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5402 Programming M̶e̶n̶t̶o̶r̶ Advisor"},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/7","custom_user_title":"5402 Programming M̶e̶n̶t̶o̶r̶ Advisor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3381280,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-07T14:55:09.814Z","cooked":"
ebear11:

Our chain was always loose so the output had a lot of play compared to the input shaft.

This is exactly the case where you want the measurement on the mechanism itself rather than on the motor - otherwise, telemetry might look qualitatively “nicer,” but the actual mechanism location is less-controlled.

Either way, there’s no great way to fix backlash in controls and the best thing to do in such a situation is to reduce the backlash

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-07T14:55:09.814Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":256,"readers_count":255,"score":61.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/8","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3381301,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-07T15:27:39.721Z","cooked":"

There is discussion of using motor encoders vs output encoders. Also of synching them.

In recent years we have been using post reduction because it is more accurate. But using the motor encoders and the built in PID on the controller is faster and frees up the Rio.

So my question is how often do you update your moot encoder position with the position data from the output encoder.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-07T15:27:39.721Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":217,"readers_count":216,"score":48.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/9","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3381313,"name":"Elijah Beard","username":"ebear11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-07T15:55:11.024Z","cooked":"
Oblarg:

This is exactly the case where you want the measurement on the mechanism itself rather than on the motor - otherwise, telemetry might look qualitatively “nicer,” but the actual mechanism location is less-controlled.

Yeah the output shaft was more “precise” but with the loose chain it performed horribly when using PID loops on the RoboRIO. Motor position control does not account for that so its more smooth. Definitely a trade-off. Obviously fixing the chain would probably be the best solution like you mentioned.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-07T15:55:11.024Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":39.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Elijah Beard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5402 Programming M̶e̶n̶t̶o̶r̶ Advisor"},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/10","custom_user_title":"5402 Programming M̶e̶n̶t̶o̶r̶ Advisor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3381316,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-07T15:58:45.003Z","cooked":"

You can use an external sensor for the internal feedback loop on most motor controllers.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-07T15:58:45.003Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":187,"readers_count":186,"score":42.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":38557,"username":"Bmongar","name":"Brad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/11","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3381920,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-08T09:57:37.378Z","cooked":"

Maybe I missed something, but I didn’t see a way to configure a DIO sensor (Rev Through Bore) to a TalonFX. I know mixing ecosystems is the problem but the CTRE through Bore adapter for CANCoder wasn’t available and the Redux through bore upgrade case worked but wasn’t very sturdy and broke on mechanism maintenance .

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-05-08T09:57:37.378Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":35.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465349,"topic_slug":"stiffer-software","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/stiffer-software/465349/12","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3381971,"name":"Elijah Beard","username":"ebear11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-08T12:04:42.359Z","cooked":"

So this is where I was confused as well. CTRE does not tell you how to use other products in their documentation explicitly, but you can do it pretty easily with library provided functions. Here is a link to our teams intake code. To explain our code (I have a bad habit of not commenting code) the TBE is set up as a DutyCycleEncoder object. You use the getEncoder() method as input for setPosition() method. A quirk I found, is that the robot has to be enabled during the call for setPosition() or it does not work. So I added code in periodic that just sets it once when it is enabled. You can then use CTRE position control normally. You could add code to set the position more than just startup though. You could do every X seconds if you like or just have the drivers press a button if something appears screwed up. There is probably a better way for how to use the TBE on CTRE devices somewhere but I could not find anything else when scouring chiefDelphi. 2024-Bot/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/Intake.java at main · IronKings-5402/2024-Bot · GitHub

You need a CTRE sensor on the CAN bus if you’re using a CTRE motor cotroller, yeah.

@ebear11 I don’t think there’s any reason to do this; if you’re piping the measurement in through the API you’re not getting any of the benefits of the faster loop rate (measurement updates are still determined by RIO loop rate) and you might as well run control on the RIO.

Our team did not do it for the loop rate. Our TBE just kept breaking, taking us out of the match. This was more of a “backup” solution where a better built robot would have been the ideal solution. CANCoders will do a better job 100%. This was just showcasing how you could do it if you had to, like us. We originally just used the TBE because we did not see a benefit either.
